document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the genus Drasteria of Central Asia and Kazakhstan with special attention to the adjacent areas (Lepidoptera: Erebidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the genus Drasteria of Central Asia and Kazakhstan with special attention to the adjacent areas (Lepidoptera: Erebidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material .
Lectotype male ( designated here in accordance with ICZN Art. 74) ( Figs. 193–195 ), labelled: “Askhabad” (white paper, printed), “Origin.” (pink paper, printed), “ex coll. 2/3 | Staudinger” (white paper, printed with handwritten numbers), “ LECTOTYPUS | Leucanitis | sinuosa (Staudinger, 1884) | Mém. Lépid. 1: 146, pl. 9, f. 5 | Korb, Matov, Volynkin des. |
2016, Feb. 1–4
” (red paper, printed) ( ZMHU )
.
Paralectotypes : 1 male , 1 female ( ZMHU )
.
Habitat ( Figs. 300, 303 ). Deserts, semideserts, steppes. Elevation: 200–1000 m .
Distribution . Deserts of Turkmenistan , Uzbekistan , Kazakhstan and North Iran . It is possible that this species occur also South-Western limits of Russia in the Astrakhan Province .

Material examined (in total: 353 specimens ).
